description.narrative: The International Comparison Program (ICP) is an international statistical program that collects and disseminates purchasing power parity (PPP) data for developing countries. These data are needed to measure and compare the performance of the different economies in the world and the socio-economic status of different groups of people. The data that is collected by the ICP is essential to measure progress towards the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) for poverty reduction. Funding under this investment provides funds to the ICP which will: 1) provide Australia with information on the progress in achieving the SDGs; and 2) provide further information for research in thematic areas to help influence the direction of future aid funding. The total value of this investment is $1.0 million expensed in the 2010-11 financial year.
